attributes.action: introduce immediate Tax Breaks and Incentives to assist and encourage small or start up businesses in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 22 April 2009 Alistair Darling announced his latest Budget. 

This Budget did not contain anything to assist and encourage small or start up businesses in the UK.

In these unprecedented economic times, the small business plays a vital part in helping to reduce the unemployment figures. 

Owners of small businesses and those wishing to take the step to start their own business should be actively supported and encouraged.

This petition has been set up to lobby the Government to introduce a package of tax breaks and incentives that will have a positive and immediate impact on small businesses and start ups.

The measures should be introduced immediately without waiting for the next PBR.

We ask Shriti Vadera, Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Competitiveness and Small Business, to meet with Alistair Darling and Gordon Brown to arrive at a suitable package of practical and effective measures.
